alert.note: Alert for Alameda; Contra Costa; San Francisco; San Mateo; Santa Clara; Santa Cruz (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 05 at 12:20PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Light to moderate rain continues to fall over the advisory area leading to flooding concerns. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Alameda, Contra Costa, San Francisco, San Mateo, Santa Clara and Santa Cruz. * WHEN...Until 245 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1218 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated additional rain moving over an already saturated area. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.1 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Jose, San Francisco, Oakland, Fremont, Hayward, Sunnyvale, Concord, Santa Clara, Berkeley, Richmond, Antioch, Daly City, San Mateo, San Leandro, Livermore, Redwood City, Mountain View, Alameda, San Ramon and Pleasanton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Alameda; Contra Costa; San Francisco; San Mateo; Santa Clara; Santa Cruz
